items: Start in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, and your feet together. Make sure your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels, with your core engaged.
Begin lowering your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your torso, as you maintain a straight body alignment.
Continue lowering your body until your chest is close to or lightly touches the ground.
Push yourself back up by straightening your arms and returning to the starting plank position, while maintaining proper body alignment.
Repeat the push-up for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form throughout the exercise.
Strengthens chest, shoulders, triceps, and core muscles
Improves overall upper body strength and endurance
Can be done anywhere without equipment
Engages multiple muscle groups at once for efficient workout
Variations can target different muscle groups and add variety to routine
Back muscles (erector spinae and latissimus dorsi)
